Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has been watered and show that the plant is healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant that has not been watered and show that the plant looks unhealthy and wilting.
The student can add details to their drawings to show that plants need water to live and grow.
The student can use colors and labels to highlight the differences between plants with and without water.
The student can draw a sun to indicate that plants also need light to grow, along with water.
